channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Over $16b in govt aid disbursed to Singaporeans, businesses
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporean workers and businesses have received more than $16 billion from government support packages so far.

item.title: Doctors see huge drop in flu, common cold, diarrhoea and conjunctivitis cases
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

There has been a dramatic drop in the number of people seeing doctors in the past two months for infectious diseases usually transmitted from person to person, with some doctors saying good hygiene and social distancing measures are major factors contributing to the slide.

item.title: Two in three print subscribers read SPH titles more, digital numbers rise
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

As most people work and study from home during the circuit breaker period, 65 per cent of Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) print subscribers have been reading newspapers more frequently compared with three months ago to stay updated on the Covid-19 situation. This was a key finding of a survey SPH commissioned last month to understand media consumption habits during this period.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Herd immunity' doesn't always work, says expert
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The "herd immunity" strategy may have worked against the H1N1 influenza pandemic a decade ago, but the coronavirus that causes Covid-19 is more infectious and severe, warned Associate Professor Alex Cook.

item.title: Community self-help groups step up assistance schemes
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Community self-help groups have stepped up assistance schemes as the number of people seeking help grows amid the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: S'pore Book Fair goes online amid outbreak
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Featuring guests such as local actor Li Nanxing, Taiwanese TV host Sisy Chen and Senior Parliamentary Secretary for Home Affairs and National Development Sun Xueling, the Singapore Book Fair returns in a revamped form for its 35th year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Case tally in Singapore dorms lower than what models predicted earlier
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

This means Singapore is reducing the number of new infections but potentially spreading them out over a longer duration.

item.title: 45 buses deployed to ferry Covid-19 patients
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

About 45 buses transport up to 600 Covid-19 patients daily, and the fleet is set to expand to 60 in the coming weeks.

item.title: $6m grant to support S'pore fintech firms
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Financial technology companies in Singapore can turn to a $6 million fund to help pay for their day-to-day expenses, including the salaries of undergraduate interns.

item.title: 70 firefighters battle early morning blaze in Tuas
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

About 70 firefighters put out an early morning blaze yesterday at a Tuas warehouse that was so intense that the heat caused walls of the property to break off.

item.title: Condo, HDB rental volumes plunge amid circuit breaker
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Demand for renting both private apartments and Housing Board flats plunged last month because of the circuit breaker measures, which prevented prospective tenants from visiting and viewing properties offered for lease, said market observers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Task force exploring ways to protect construction workers
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Guidelines being looked at will cover safe worksites, accommodation and transport.

item.title: US pilot jailed for breaching stay order
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

An American commercial pilot, who breached a stay order early last month, was sentenced to four weeks' jail yesterday.

item.title: Nine more arrested over rioting case in Chinatown
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The search continues for two people linked to a rioting case at a Chinatown apartment block on Sunday, after police arrested nine more suspects - eight men and one woman - on Tuesday.

item.title: Massage amid circuit breaker: Accused breaks down in court
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The prosecution has called for a fine of at least $21,000 for a woman accused of offering massage and sexual services at a beauty salon amid the circuit breaker measures.

item.title: Over $16b in Covid-19 govt aid given out so far: Indranee
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

More than $16 billion in Covid-19 government assistance has been given out so far, as Singapore crosses the halfway mark of the circuit breaker period, said Second Minister for Finance Indranee Rajah.

item.title: 2 cleaners face the music after harassing public officers
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

A cleaner was jailed and another fined yesterday for hurling vulgarities at public servants in separate incidents during the Covid-19 outbreak. Both of the convicted men are Singaporeans.

item.title: Ease curbs carefully to avoid large peak in coronavirus infections: Expert
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will need to tread carefully as it eases its circuit breaker measures amid the Covid-19 outbreak, as there could still be a "large peak" in infections down the road, an expert has warned.

item.title: Stabbed NParks officer recovering at home, thankful for support
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Parks Board (NParks) officer, who almost lost a finger in an attack at Sungei Serangoon Park Connector, is out of hospital and recuperating at home.

item.title: 958 Covid-19 patients in Singapore discharged in new daily high; 675 new cases reported
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

This is the second time this week that the number of patients discharged has exceeded the number of new cases.

item.title: Security officer among 3 accused of breaching stay-home notice
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

A security officer who was on a stay-home notice (SHN) breached it repeatedly to continue working, the court heard yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mobile station aims to make swabbing at dorms faster, safer
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

A new mobile swab station has been rolled out, aimed at making it faster and safer for healthcare workers doing Covid-19 swab tests at foreign worker dormitories.

item.title: Fewer accidents as roads are more free-flowing now
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

The roads in Singapore are significantly more free-flowing and safer than before the Covid-19 outbreak, even if the percentage of speeding cases and breakdowns has climbed.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ever-changing profile of a silent killer with many questions left unanswered
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

Why is this virus so much more contagious than Sars? Why do some patients develop a severe form of the disease while others do not?

item.title: In a first, 115 called to S'pore Bar via Zoom
item.description:
May 14, 2020 5:00 AM

In an unprecedented move, the Supreme Court admitted 115 lawyers to the Singapore Bar yesterday via Zoom, a videoconferencing platform.
